thread.title: Shell declares force majeure on Nigerian gas supplies to NLNG
thread.title_full: Shell declares force majeure on Nigerian gas supplies to NLNG

title: Shell declares force majeure on Nigerian gas supplies to NLNG
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Aug 6, 2015, 13:22 BST - UK Markets close in 3 hrs 8 mins Shell declares force majeure on Nigerian gas supplies to NLNG Reuters - UK Focus – 6 minutes ago 1,877.50 +1.5000 
ABUJA, Aug 6 (Reuters) - Shell (LSE: RDSB.L - news ) declared force majeure on gas supplies to Nigeria's LNG export terminal on Bonny Island in Rivers State due to a pipeline leak, a spokesman for the company said on Thursday. 
"Shell declared force majeure on gas supplies from SPDC to NLNG (Nigeria Liquefied Natural Gas Co), effective August 4," spokesman Precious Okolobo said, adding that the company was still investigating the cause of the leak. 
SPDC is Shell's Nigerian joint venture with state oil company Nigerian National Petroleum Corp. (Reporting by Julia Payne; additional reporting by Oleg Vukmanovic in Milan; editing by Jason Neely) Tax cuts, pensions, childcare, online accounts and beer duty, here's … Related Stock Articles Should You Follow Director Buying At Royal Dutch Shell Plc And ARM Holdings plc? - Fool.co.uk Follow the quotes you care about most.
